data.title: The student's marks
data.statement:
You are tasked with implementing a Grade Calculator program that takes as input the scores of various students in multiple subjects and calculates their final grades based on predefined grading criteria. The program should provide the corresponding letter grade for each student based on their average score.

The corresponding letter grade based on the average score, according to the following grading scale:
90.00 - 100.00: A
80.00 - 89.99: B
70.00 - 79.99: C
60.00 - 69.99: D
Below 60.00: F

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut:
Alice 89.00 B
Bob 74.33 C
Charlie 92.00 A

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testOut:
Tom 82.50 B
Sara 93.00 A
Peter 70.00 C

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testOut:

Oliver 45.00 F
Ava 67.67 D

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testOut:
Liam 35.00 F
Mia 25.00 F
Noah 55.00 F
Sophia 40.00 F

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testOut:
Jennifer 88.67 B
Kevin 77.67 C
Emma 92.00 A
David 80.00 B
Sophia 87.67 B

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testOut:
John 89.00 B
Emily 78.75 C
Michael 88.75 B
Sophia 91.00 A
Daniel 68.75 D

data.constraints:
0 < [[name]] length < 100
[[name]] will always be one word will and won't contain any space nor special characters.
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 1000
1 ≤ [[K]] ≤ 10
0 ≤ [[score]] ≤ 100
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read student:string(256)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: Positive integer [[N]] representing the number of students.
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: Space-separated input containing each student's [[name]] and the [[scores]] in [[K]] subjects. Each score is an integer representing the student's score in a particular subject.
data.outputDescription:
<<[[N]] lines>> of space-separated:
The name of the student.
The average score rounded to two decimal places.
The grade the student got.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are tasked with implementing a Grade Calculator program that takes as input the scores of various students in multiple subjects and calculates their final grades based on predefined grading criteria. The program should provide the corresponding letter grade for each student based on their average score.

The corresponding letter grade based on the average score, according to the following grading scale:
90.00 - 100.00: A
80.00 - 89.99: B
70.00 - 79.99: C
60.00 - 69.99: D
Below 60.00: F
Input
Line 1: Positive integer N representing the number of students.
Next N lines: Space-separated input containing each student's name and the scores in K subjects. Each score is an integer representing the student's score in a particular subject.
Output
N lines of space-separated:
The name of the student.
The average score rounded to two decimal places.
The grade the student got.
Constraints
0 < name length < 100
name will always be one word will and won't contain any space nor special characters.
1 ≤ N ≤ 1000
1 ≤ K ≤ 10
0 ≤ score ≤ 100
Example
Input
3
Alice 85 90 92
Bob 78 80 65
Charlie 92 88 96
Output
Alice 89.00 B
Bob 74.33 C
Charlie 92.00 A
